front.title: Timestamp extension flag for In Situ Operations, Administration, and Maintenance (IOAM) Direct Export

abstract.t: This document defines new extension flags for the In Situ Operations, Administration, and Maintenance (IOAM) Direct Export option type. The new flags allow IOAM DEX Option-type to add a timestamp into the header.

note.title: Requirements Language
note.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in BCP 14 when, and only when, they appear in all capitals, as shown here.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: Network operators require delay monitoring accros their network, notably when some services undergo long end-to-end delays. Nodes can use IOAM in order to report this delay to a collector.
In order to support delay monitoring in postcard mode so as to leverage aggregation; IOAM Direct Export Option-type (DEX) needs to be extended to accomodate delay monitoring.
This document defines two new Extension flags for IOAM DEX Option-type to be able to add a timestamp in the header.

section.title: Solution overview
section.t: The IOAM DEX Option-type format is defined in Section 3.2. To be able to mesure the delay between the encapsulation node and the current node, we suggest to add a timestamp to the IOAM DEX option-type as illustrated in .
This document proposes two optional fields to be included in the IOAM DEX option type format that can be enabled using IOAM DEX Extension-Flags (Using currently unassigned Extension-Flags 2 and 3).

section.title: Timestamp formats
section.t: We refer to use the format of Section 5 to encode the Timestamp Seconds and Timestamp Fraction fields.

section.title: Export method
section.t: The mechanism and associated formats for exporting the delay metrics are outside the scope of this document.
A way to perform data export of monitored delay using the method described in this document is proposed in .

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: The security considerations for the IOAM DEX Option-type are described in . This documents adds no additional security considerations.

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t: IANA would be required to reserve two bits in the "IOAM DEX Extension-Flags" registry.
These are the proposed bits for the timestamp extensions:

Bit: 3 Description: Timestamp Fraction Reference: this document
